citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for DAPP and Leptospirosis annually and rabies at 18 weeks, then at 1 year, and then
every 3 years going forward.
3 adult dogs are not up to date on their Rabies vaccine:
-Chocolate Drop#5433
-Oreo#3783
-Howard#7959
2 adult dogs with a date of birth of 27 April 2024 did not have a record of a current rabies vaccine:
-No name assigned#9788
-No name assigned#7884
1 adult dog with a date of birth of 2 December 2023 did not have a record of a current rabies or DAPP/Leptospirosis
vaccine:
-No name assigned #2909
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo,
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or
contagious diseases.
The facility has not performed the annual fecal sampling for internal parasites. Medical records show the last samples
obtained were on 12 October 2023. The Program of Veterinary Care states fecal exams will be performed annually
with10% of the kennel being sampled for intestinal parasites. Failure to follow the parasite control program approved by
the attending veterinarian may not properly protect the dogs from parasites and may allow illness to go undetected and
untreated, which may cause pain and unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the parasite control
testing schedule approved by the attending veterinarian to protect the dogs from parasites and other pests (worms,
coccidia, giardia and heartworm) and have the dogs tested annually.
Correct by 30 December 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently 
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for DAPP and Leptospirosis annually and rabies at 18 weeks, then at 1 year, and then 
every 3 years going forward.  
3 adult dogs are not up to date on their Rabies vaccine: 
-Chocolate Drop#5433 
-Oreo#3783 
-Howard#7959 
 2 adult dogs with a date of birth of 27 April 2024 did not have a record of a current rabies vaccine: 
-No name assigned#9788 
-No name assigned#7884  
1 adult dog with a date of birth of 2 December 2023 did not have a record of a current rabies or DAPP/Leptospirosis 
vaccine:  
-No name assigned #2909 
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the 
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo, 
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or 
contagious diseases.  
 
The facility has not performed the annual fecal sampling for internal parasites. Medical records show the last samples 
obtained were on 12 October 2023. The Program of Veterinary Care states fecal exams will be performed annually 
with10% of the kennel being sampled for intestinal parasites. Failure to follow the parasite control program approved by 
the attending veterinarian may not properly protect the dogs from parasites and may allow illness to go undetected and 
untreated, which may cause pain and unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the parasite control 
testing schedule approved by the attending veterinarian to protect the dogs from parasites and other pests (worms, 
coccidia, giardia and heartworm) and have the dogs tested annually.  
Correct by 30 December 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

n
